title: [Boards Update 6/25] Updated Navigation to Align with LeagueofLegends.com

replies.body:
revert this now.

I hated the change to the home page, and this is even worse. Now I can't go to the dev tracker at all. Previously you increased the number of clicks I had to make because of your stupid change. Now I can't get there at all.

> [{quoted}](name=Thryale,realm=NA,application-id=bzRrPGQO,discussion-id=mxygTO72,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2015-06-25T23:27:11.709+0000)
>
> revert this now.
> 
> I hated the change to the home page, and this is even worse. Now I can't go to the dev tracker at all. Previously you increased the number of clicks I had to make because of your stupid change. Now I can't get there at all.

<<< There's a link to it to the left (Red Tracker)
I just want to read the Red Tracker most of the time. Can you add a link directly to there from the top border?

> [{quoted}](name=Hellioning,realm=NA,application-id=bzRrPGQO,discussion-id=mxygTO72,comment-id=000300000000,timestamp=2015-06-25T23:37:33.383+0000)
>
> I just want to read the Red Tracker most of the time. Can you add a link directly to there from the top border?

It would make more sense IMHO, since that's a personal preference, that you create a bookmark in your browser for that.

I'd just like to say that until now, when I opened up the LoL website I'd go straight to the Boards *just so I could use its navigation bar*.

Yes, the experience is now consistent, but consistently sucks as a result. Somebody obviously put work into getting that navigation bar to look all neat, but removed 90% of its functionality to do so.

It's funny because while making it look neat they also made it way smaller so it's actually harder to see the neatness.  I'm honestly confused as to how the nav bar passed through UX, it's not up to the quality I generally expect from Riot.

I'm not saying it's the developers' fault at all on this feature, I'm just tired of these things happening with no transparency or input from the community whatsoever.

aye! what this man says.

before, I could easily get to the dev tracker with just one mouse click from the home page. Now I have to click "boards" then scroll down and click the dev tracker link.

Personally, I very much dislike the sidebar menu. Menus should be at the top of the page, and out of site unless needed. None of that magic "follow you and hog up precious real estate" that a lot of newer sites are doing.
I guess. Then the question is 'why did you change it?' Did dropdown menus kill your family or something?

riiiiiiiiighhhhhhhht. because having to click on "boards" from the home page then scrolling down to click on a link hidden among a bunch of other links is sooooooooooooooooooo much more convenient that just hovering over "boards" on the home page and clicking "dev tracker" from the drop down menu.

Why are dropdowns taboo in this scenario?  The Red Tracker is likely the most used tab on the entire Boards platform, and removing it from the old navigation tab was just...weird.  It's an extra page and an extra click for users that want to access it, for no other reason than the fact that for some reason clean UI is more important to you (Riot) than basic functionality.

I also hated the change to the home page, but just for the reason that they increased the amount of clicks it takes to get to a lot of the most commonly visited pages.  What they should do is have a hover option on the menu bar that goes to subsections of pages.  This would ease a lot of pain from this implementation.  Also, lock the top bar to the top of the page so it is always accessible.

no no no no no. I **hate** having menu bars follow you around. If I have to spend more than 30 secs on a site with that feature, I instantly pull up "inspect element" and delete the nuisance right away.

> If I have to spend more than 30 secs on a **sight **with that feature, I instantly pull up "inspect element" and delete the nuisance right away.

Congrats to you for that.  Glad you hate having more than 30 seconds of sight.  Maybe you should just gouge your eyes out :P
don't be a douche

Cause you're not being one to Riot?

btw...nice edit changing it to the proper "site" :P

Ya'll need to settle this and move on.  Thryale dislikes following menu bars, and that's fine.  The part about having it follow is completely personal preference, so I respect that.

Also, I agree with you (BadxWolf) about a hover option for dropdowns; it existed on the old navigation bar, I have no idea why Riot has this desire to value clean visual over function.
I'm just havin a little fun pointing out his typo is all.  Never disagreed with his opinion/preference.

Hello, yes, I kind of liked my drop down menus? Please?

What's the point of having the news subsections if it's darn near impossible to access them? Please put in drop down menus again, please. I beg of you.

Point of reference: I used the Red Tracker as my main page for League BECAUSE IT HAD DROP DOWN MENUS.

Oops, meant to reply to you, Zerg. 

The News page in particular is something I'm addressing with the team that handles it.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/site-feedback/1huVpnTr-patch-notes-dev-blog-and-the-new-status-bar

Hey remember that post I made 4 months ago that got 1200 views and no responses? "Patch notes, Dev Blog, and the New Status Bar" ?  That drop down was the only way to access any of those pages. There aren't links on other pages to them. We can't reference the old patch notes now without clicking back 10,000 times or using an off-site search engine. 

We don't even have anything to click on to see our posts and discussions homepage thing. We have to post something and THEN click our name to get there. Why did you think this was ready to be rolled out?

Please. I hated the new login bar because of this. Pardon my language but it's a fucking pain in the ass in sort through News right now. Drop down menus for each Board would be nice too. Include the Red Tracker in it.

The Champ Info tab is something that needs a lot of attention.  It takes so many clicks to get to the info that I want.  It was much easier having it dropdown to multiple subsections of the page.  Also, the server status page should have a place on your top menu bar.  ONE MORE THING please have the top menu bar autolock to the top of the page so it is always accessible.

I don't understand why the initial goal was to implement a **less functional** navigation bar on the main page.  I was glad the Boards team had some sense and kept the one that actually had ***basic*** functionality like dropdowns and actual specific navigation, but apparently that's no longer the case.

I'm aware this is harsh, but the new nav bar is not only **less visually appealing** (subjective) but it's ***less functional*** (objective), which is literally the entire point of UX as a discipline.
Site navigation from the home page was not nearly as good as from the (now old) Boards page. Why do I not have dropdown menus from them?
cuz apparently riot hates drop down menus. despite them being efficient and more user friendly.
So, is there no way to filter news by patch notes now?

OK, but what about other players? What about players that join 5 months from now, long after your post is buried in the obscure depths of the boards? That's the type of thing that should be in the website navigation somewhere.
Seriously have the notifications about replies totally gone? also no way to check your own post history?
Neither of those things are gone... there is a new notifications icon in the upper right corner, and you can check your own profile still through the one-stop profile dropdown.

Where?

Cause I don't see it.
It took me a while (hours) for that to appear. Try a relog it might help.
Just relogged, did not help.
Patience then, I don't know what triggered it for me.
Yes I noticed few hours after the comment. It took really long btw, might be because of some update issue because I'm always logged in.

WTF did you guys do! You screwed it up... please revert NOW.

And I agree, Red Tracker at the top, easier to find.

Bookmarking it is a fail solution.

**This sucks... why do you guys insist on making everything worse & worse with the Boards.**
I think you need to make it more clear what board I’m on, it seems the only way to see if I’m on the EUW or NA board is by looking at the browser search bar.

If you look to the upper right corner, it says what region you're in.
http://puu.sh/iCQSp/5d88b3350c.jpg

That part is the same on both boards 
http://i.imgur.com/T7VO7c8.jpg
http://imgur.com/MrbGgmz
Because people from other part of the world can write on the NA board does that role bar not tell anything else than from what region I’m from not what boards I at the moment are watching.

I assume there is no going back now, so I have a suggestion.

#Can you make Notifications and New Replies buttons more visible?

Right now they look as if were behind a dark glass or something and numbers on both are so darn small I can't make out if there are 3 or 5 responses.
Yah i have a problem you guys broke my custom theme >_> ffs sigh it will be while before i can fix it too.... dammit riot (✿◡‿◡)

still doesn't take me to my updates when I click it.  Only takes me to the boards main page, been having this problem since boards started.  Every once in a blue moon I get taken to my updates but its months in the interim where it doesn't work.
I don't have the notifications/update icons http://prntscr.com/7le312
help?
It's part of the navigation bar now, at the top right.

It wasn't, if you looked at my screenshot, it was completely blank


After restarting my browser and waiting 20 minutes after getting a reply, it's there now :D 

Thanks for the help anyways
It looks like you had a cookie that was stopping the rework from loading properly, but I'm glad it's all set now!  No problem.
Meanwhile the notification/reply UI has gone
It's part of the navigation bar now, at the top right.
